titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Department of History, Yale University, Senior Prize Essays
Department of History, Yale University, Senior Prize Essays
titlestmt.author: compiled by Staff of Manuscripts and Archives

publicationstmt.publisher: Yale University. Department of Manuscripts and Archives

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on Friday January 11, 2019 at 08:01

did.unittitle: Department of History, Yale University, senior prize essays

repository.corpname: Yale University. Department of Manuscripts and Archives

did.abstract: The materials consist of senior prize essays transferred by the Department of History since 1991. A few essays by non-seniors are also included.

odd.head: General note
odd.p: Forms part of Yale Record Group 14-B (YRG 14-B), Records of academic departments and programs of the Yale Faculty of Arts and Sciences.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: The materials were transferred from the Department of History, 1991-2018.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Copyright has not been transferred to Yale University. Requires written permission of the author or copyright holder to photocopy.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Department of History, Yale University, Senior Prize Essays (RU 170). Manuscripts and Archives, Yale University Library.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Yale University records are arranged and described at the accession level by the creating office. The University Archives creates collection level descriptive records, but typically does no further arrangement and description at the accession level.

originalsloc.head: Existence and Location of Originals
originalsloc.p: Senior prize essays transferred prior to 1991 are classed in the Yale Student Papers Collection (RU 331).

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: The materials are open for research.

Original born digital files, as well as preservation masters, may not be accessed due to their fragility. Researchers must consult use copies, or if none exist request that they be made. Born digital files cannot be accessed remotely. System requirements include a Manuscripts and Archives computer and file viewing software.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The materials consist of senior prize essays transferred by the Department of History since 1991. A few essays by non-seniors are also included.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The materials are arranged by accession.

did.unittitle: History senior essay prize winners

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The essays are arranged chronologically by academic year and alphabetically by author therein. Non-senior essay writers are indicated by a class year in parentheses after their name. The name of the prize, if known, is listed in italics.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Accession consists of student essays awarded or honorably mentioned for the Richard Hegel Prize for essays related to New Haven.
